Amis: namakuda a kinakemudan na su varung?
English: What kind of clothes do you like?

Amis: muri veneli aken tua drikidrikitj a lima nu kavan.
English: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

Amis: izuanan a nia vucelacelay kata samljam.
English: We have white and blue ones too.

Amis: pay pavay aken tu tacaucauan tua samljam a kava.
English: Please give me the clothes in blue.

Amis: Camak kasinu sun tasauni? na kipalalaciq sun?
English: Camak, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

Amis: Camak kasinu sun tasauni? na undu sun?
English: Camak, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

Amis: ini, na vaik aken a pusaladj tjay vuvu a paveli tua ljaceng.
English: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

Amis: ini, na vaik aken a pusaladj tjay kacumusu a paveli tua ljaceng.
English: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

Amis: manu kemuda, izua su cug nu qezemetj? makaya itjen a malingulj a keman?
English: No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

Amis: ikamakaya, muri vaik aken a veneli tua kava.
English: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

Amis: pay pida kakavelian naicu a djinaljeng a ljaceng.
English: Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

Amis: nu tadjaljengan a ljaceng drusa puluq a vatan.
English: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

Amis: aicu a vurasi pida a kakavelian.
English: How much are these sweet potatoes?

Amis: nu tatjingtjingan a vurasi tjelu a puluq a vatan.
English: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

Amis: pay pavay aken tu drusa djaljeng ta ljaceng kata tatjingtjingan a vurasi.
English: Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

Amis: Camak, malim anga aken a masi siquliqulip makaya aken a su pasedjaman?
English: Camak, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

Amis: neka uta nu niaken, ni Muni aicu.
English: I don’t have one either. This is Muni’s.

Amis: saka makaya ku kisedjamen a palamu? palamu sa ku pacikeli tjanusun.
English: Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

Amis: maljimalji, pumaljimaljian anga aken uta tjay Muni.
English: Thank you and thank Muni for me.

Amis: muri pacikel aken taicu a drusa sunatj.
English: I want to return these two books.
No problem and what else do you need?

Amis: muri kisedjam anan aken taicu a tjelu a sunatj.
English: I would like to borrow these three books.

Amis: padria. paqenetju nu sipakatjelulj a qadav keljan anga penacikel.
English: Sure and remember to return them after three days.

Amis: inia su pacikeli a ku siquliqulip lja.
English: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

Amis: saka aku ika anga mapacucun a ku siquliqulip.
English: Then, why is my eraser missing?

Amis: inika su sinipasedjam anga tjay Camak.
English: Did you lend it to Camak?

Amis: qadjav. pay ku kivavadaqay anga timadju.
English: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

Amis: aza ku siquliqulip sau kisedjamu anan.
English: I will lend you my eraser first.

Amis: Muni, aicu a uba sini pasedjam pay ni Camak tjanusun?
English: Muni, did Camak lend you this coat?

Amis: ini, aicu vinli ni kina tjanuaken.
English: No, my mom bought it for me.

Amis: aza uba ni Camak mamav kata nisun.
English: Camak’s coat is the same as yours.

Amis: aza nimadju a uba qucengecengel, maretimalj a nia quljav.
English: His coat is black, so our colors are different.

Amis: Muni, nakisedjam sun tjay Camak tua valjitjuq?
English: Muni, did you borrow money from Camak?

Amis: Muni, nakisedjam sun tjay Camak tua paisu?
English: Muni, did you borrow money from Camak?

Amis: ui, muri ku pacikelen a vuaq a ku varung, ljakua malim aken a masi valjitjuq.
English: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

Amis: ui, muri ku pacikelen a vuaq a ku varung, ljakua malim aken a masi paisu.
English: Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

Amis: au saka nungida anga su pacikelen?
English: Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

Amis: ui, ku pusaladjay anga sun a pasasinukukuz tjai Camak.
English: Okay, I will tell Camak for you.

Amis: aicu a kikulavav tjara sipuqacev nu puparaung, aicu a kitjikuray tjara sipuseluc nu puparaung, manazua padriadria.
English: It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

Amis: manukemuda, pasalisaliv aken! djaljepan a ika aken a makadjameq.
English: No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

Amis: pay ku tuluay anan sun a mumalj tu aicu a masan musalj a sisan puraungan.
English: Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

Amis: nanguaq! padria angata! pay nu matazua nu tjaivililj ki aken a makadjameq anga tua qaljuqaljupen.
English: Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

Amis: qaqacan anga cemel i vavua, sau vaiku a sema salang a malap tua kaukav, vaiki a sema vavua.
English: The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

Amis: aza izua itua tjakaz i tjuljivar, nu temdep sun i salang ki su pacuni.
English: It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

Amis: kipapaulingavu nu malap, nakuya mapasaqetju radjay aravac a kaukav.
English: Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

Amis: i patekuteku ta zua kasiv aza ku sinipuraung.
English: My trap is under that tree.

Amis: ku pinukakeljanga a pimaza, kemeljang aken tu inu a ku sinipuraung.
English: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

Amis: ku pinukakeljanga a pimaza, kemeljang aken tu izainu a ku sinipuraung.
English: I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

Amis: varas aicu, nia piniljaving tua pana a venaras tua ciqav.
English: This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

Amis: tiamen i pasa zuwa neka nu nia varas, savid tu penanadip amen nu kiciqav.
English: We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

Amis: inia ku seljudj a penanadip, tuluy anga aken nu tjaivililj dri?
English: I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

Amis: padria! kaciuri anga nu tjaivililj a penanadip.
English: Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

Amis: nanguaq! kaciuri anga nu tjaivililj a penanadip.
English: Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

Amis: au nu tjaivililj ku tuluay anga sun tua seman varas.
English: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

Amis: aza su panadip matidrtidrtidr anga, palemek tu izua anga natjekalavis a ciqav! kirirnu viljevilju.
English: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

Amis: mayanan, mizazingay aravac a varukur. tjaljumaza aken a veniljevilj tua kalavis, sau pusaladji aken a mazuwa malap ta aray.
English: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

Amis: pay viljevilju a pasa maza i tjanuaken aza ciqav. ku pusaladjay sun a veniljevilj.
English: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

Amis: padria angata! na puqadav a vuaq, namapeljuq anga mareka kuni.
English: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

Amis: ari vaiki tja pakalevay a masantalj.
English: Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

Amis: sinciuanga tucu a adau, yasumi nu tjuau, vaiki a kinangevang!
English: It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

Amis: anema rusu kudain nu tjyau a kadjamadjaman?
English: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

Amis: nutjyau ripaitjin, aru sema tjukai amen ka tji kina.
English: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

Amis: valauvau aken, a ru ma binziu aken.
English: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

Amis: sinsi, sae’tju sa ku tjiyalj, ma binziu aken.
English: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

Amis: makaya ken na vaik a milima?
English: May I go wash my hands?

Amis: aru patjezuanga a tja zikan, mai yanang.
English: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

Amis: sinsi, sae’tju sa ku ulu, kiatju’ aken nu na itjau anga.
English: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

Amis: uwi, kipa paulingavu a tjalju tjuma’.
English: Okay, take care and go home.

Amis: sinsi, puri kiyadju’ aken nu tjaivelilj, nu siciyi aru kipucemel aken.
English: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

Amis: sae’tju a tjiyal ni selep, vaik a ma binziu.
English: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

Amis: sinsi, sae’tju a liqu ni sulja, ikana mantjez.
English: Teacher, sulja has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

Amis: lja pakedavi a tji selep aken, izuanga tapulu’ aku cavilj.
English: My name is pakedavi a tji selep, and I’m 10 years old.

Amis: tjiaken lja pakedavi a tji sulja.
English: My name is pakedvai a tji sulja.
What ethnic group are you from?
Are all your family members indigenous?
Yes, my whole family is Paiwan.
Are all your family members indigenous?

Amis: yini’, amin tji kama a kacaljsiyan, tji kina paran.
English: No, my father is Paiwan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

Amis: tji tjama a zua? pida anga cavilj ni tjama?
English: Is that your father? How old is he?

Amis: tji kama izuanga unem katu pulu’ a cavilj.
tji tjama a zua? pida anga cavilj ni tjama?
English: Is that your father? How old is he?

Amis: ini’, azu nia vuljuvuljun i inaljan, izuanga aluapulu’acavilj ni madju.
English: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

Amis: tji kaka izuanga tapulu’ katu alu a cavilj.
tjavuljun tu liauv a cacvlj ni su kaka tja nusun?
English: Is your brother much older than you?

Amis: tjaljaljak aken tu lima cavilj tjai madju.
izua taidai katu sepatj a pulu’ aku kina aca.
cuwai yanga ikatjen na micevun, matju muaca anga sun?
English: I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

Amis: uwi, muacanga aken tu taidi katu tjelu a pulu’.
uwi, mukural angaken tu tjielua pulju’.
aru vaik’ aken a ma pankunse a kimin tjia sinsi.
English: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

Amis: aru vaik’ a venulju’ tua cemel tji madju.
English: He’s going to throw away the trash.

Amis: izua i ljaljanguwiyan tji pantjer, aru kiyan a pisai tua ljemangwi tjimadju.
English: He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

Amis: izai nu tji selep? aru mekelj anga tji madju nu sauni.
English: Where is selep? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

Amis: izua i kakaepuan tji madju, ku kimau.
English: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

Amis: vaik nan aken a veneli tua ku cengelj, ku kimau anga sun nu sauni.
English: I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.
Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

Amis: kimitua aliali, aru vaik’ aken na kimim tjai sinsi.
English: You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

Amis: tucu a adau aru kian tji gusiu tua cuiciu?
English: Is gusiu competing in croquet today?

Amis: ini’, aru kiyan tji madju tua midjuruk.
English: No, he’s competing in high jump.
Will you compete in the sports day?

Amis: uei, aru kian aken a mekelj.

English: Will you compete in the sports day?

Amis: anema aru tja kudaing nu ngndukaidukai?
English: What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.

Amis: aru paveli tjen tua kakanen nu ungndjukaidjukai?
English: Will we sell food at the sports day?

Amis: kacimas sun, pasa makya sun a rac!
English: Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

Amis: izua na tae’d i tua aqerengang njimadju?
English: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

Amis: neka’ ri .tjau vaivaik. nu masuljem anga ki pantjez.
English: No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

Amis: iazui nikai. sau ljivavau a kiminm.
English: He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

Amis: izua a caucau a caucau i tjuma’?
sulja cuai angaken na ini’ ka pacun tja nusun na suljivatje sun?
English: It’s sulja. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

Amis: ui na suljivat a ken.vaca’ aken na ljimizau tja nusun.
English: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

Amis: izaua i kakesan ku djau lau.
English: He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

Amis: vai ka sema pukukan a djemekep ta kuka.
English: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

Amis: neka’ i tjuma’ tja suvuvu izua i vavua kaljavu i tjuma’.
English: Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

Amis: matjez anga sun ayau kama i palan.
cuai a ngaken ini’ ka pacun tja nusun. meaca anga sun.
English: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.
It’s so good to see you.

Amis: za sa panguralj se’tju a pasa pinsan.
English: Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

Amis: cuai a ngasun a ini’ka kivala ku aivuau tjaiza sa tjen a matjvetjevel a kaiv.
English: It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

Amis: pumayanga tjemekel a ken ta ucia ka mesen iladi sa tja mare aivuivu.
English: No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

Amis: tjau kinesakesa aicu a kuka kacu sa su kanin i tjuma’.
English: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

Amis: makaya tjen a micevun nuna itjau anga nu tiyau.
English: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

Amis: i tania gaku puri pasan angamen.
English: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

Amis: i ta na kaka’puan kau maya aru na kemacalisiyanan aken.
English: Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

Amis: nguangua’ a inhua ita na inaljan nu kalja mauragan kelju anga.
English: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

Amis: nu ka lja veveanga nanga cuai a ravac.
English: That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?
Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

Amis: aku sun na kicepeliu a ma inaljan.
English: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

Amis: aku in’ i paran a pasupu.
English: Why not teach in the city?

Amis: ayatua sengnelit a ken taku inaljan puri pacikel aken ta ku picul.
English: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

Amis: macau su a teminun tjima na tumulu?
English: You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

Amis: tji vuvuv tja lecauan tji madju i inaljan a trminun.
English: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

Amis: ku su na puvarun a kicauan.
English: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

Amis: ulja pacusu ai cu a tja kakudan a yaken.
English: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

Amis: sangnuua’ aravac ai cu a vava.
anema nu su cauan aru cuai nu sema vava.
English: You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?
No, it only takes about a week.

Amis: izua silji kata ljakiu. tjiaken a na temalem!
English: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

Amis: tjengelai aken taicu a kava. pida?
English: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?
It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

Amis: aljai nu tjamadele aru sunsuru aken.
English: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

Amis: pai numaya. azua ucencenl paka itau.
English: Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

Amis: puri veneli aken ta vakal kataicu a tjaljuljis.
English: I want this knife and this pot.

Amis: rusa kuzul. kusi na lima a mesensen. makaya a sikuda a cuai.
English: It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

Amis: ku ali a na siukai ta nu aken a mamaza. makaya tjama djele.
English: I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

Amis: kelju kelju samazau a pacun. izua kava a tjalupun izu penuljat.
English: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

Amis: a kava nu ita tjiluaidai katu tapulju’ nutjelu takuzul.
English: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

Amis: veneli aken paka ita ke lan ta va’uan.
English: I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

Amis: djavadjavai.puri veneli aken ta djuaidjuai kata linatu ta makau a vutjulj.
English: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

Amis: maka pavelianganken ta kinsa. izuanan a cuniupin, veneli sun?
English: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

Amis: pai nu maya veneli aken tua ita. nu tjai veliljangan veneliangan ken ta kinsa.
English: Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.

Amis: bulabulay mun a mapuljat. tucu a qadaw uri temulu a sinsi tjanumun tua anemaya a sepayuan a caucau nu qivu tua kakesain.
English: Hello everyone. Today, I am going to teach you how to say the Paiwan language for food.

Amis: pucucug mun tua kai nua sinsi?
English: Do you understand what the teacher says?

Amis: sinsi, ini ku pucug. maqati sun a qivu a puita?
English: I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

Amis: inika ken a namakalangda, maqati sun a tjamezangal anan a pagalju?
English: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

Amis: pacunu a pasamaza! kicualu tjanuaken a semupu a puita.
English: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

Amis: supu anga a puita. papezangalu anan.
English: Read it again. Please speak louder.

Amis: sinsi, namadraudraw aken a masi inpic.
English: I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my eraser.

Amis: kisedjamun tua siulaulaw nua i ljaqedi a su salasaladj.
English: Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

Amis: pasedjami aken tua su siulaulaw uii?
patjemaza a tja kitulu tucu, ucevucevungi anga nu tjaivililj a niciu.
English: Class dismissed, see you next week.

Amis: aljak aken ni Kuliw, ti Kapi a ku ngadan.
English: I am the son of Kuliw, and my name is Kapi.

Amis: situ aken ni Camak, ti Giyu aken.
English: I am a student in Camak, my name is Giyu.

Amis: ti Kuliw a ngada nua ku kama.
ku kaka tjavulu timadju, ti Tjukadr timadju.
English: He is my brother, his name is Tjukadr.

Amis: ini, ti Puljaljuyan a ngadan nimadju.
ti Umi azua. ku kina timadju.
ku drava timadju, ti Madraw timadju.
English: She is my friend and her name is Madraw.

Amis: tucu a cavilj tapuljuq anga ku cavilj.
izua tapuljuq saka drusa a cavilj nimadju tucu.
pidanga a cavilj nua su kama tucu?
lima puluq anga cavilj nua ku kama tucu.
izua mapida a marka su kaka?
English: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

Amis: izua madrusa a ku kaka tjavulu, izua macidilj a ku kaka a tjaljaljak.
English: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

Amis: izua su kaka a tjavulu a uqaljai?

English: How many people are in your family?

Amis: izua masepatj a men ita nia kinacemkeljan.
English: There are four of us in our family.
What does your uncle do for a living?

Amis: izua sengsengan nua su kaka a tjavulung?
English: Does your sister have a job?

Amis: uii, ljakua se Drekai zuku timadju.
English: Yes, but she is a Drekai.

Amis: uii, qaqacaqacan amen a mapuljat a tacenkeljan.
English: Yes, we are all very tall.

Amis: kitulutulu anga a su kaka a vavayan a tjaljaljak?
English: Does your sister go to school?

Amis: saigu a qivu ta pinayuanan a marka su kaka a tjaljaljaljak tjanusun?
English: Do your siblings speak the language?

Amis: uii, saigu tiamadju a qivu ta pinayuanan a kai.
English: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

Amis: izua mapida a mareka su kaka?
English: How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.

Amis: nakitevelj su ta su kama kata su kina?
English: Do you live with your parents?

Amis: uii, nakitevelj a ken ta ku kama kata ku kina.
English: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

Amis: a su vuvu a uqaljai a vavayan nakitevelj uta tjanusun?
English: Do you live with your grandparents?

Amis: ini, inika ken a nakitevelj tjayamadju.
English: No, I didn’t live with them.

Amis: nakitevelj aken tjai kama, tjai kina, kata ku kaka a tjavulung a uqaljai.
English: I live with my father, mother and brother.

Amis: izua i Akaw a nia tapaw.
izua i Kasuga a nia qinaljan.
nu makudakuda a su sivaikan a sema qinaljan?
English: When are you going back to the tribe?

Amis: nu pulavalavai a i gakku tjara vaik ken a maumaq.
English: I will go back in the summer.

Amis: cemdas anga a qadaw, maculju a ravac a qadaw.
English: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

Amis: ini, venali anga, vucele a kirimu.
ini a vucelelj a ravac, ini a maculju a ravac, sarunguanguaq a ravac.
English: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

Amis: neka nu qerepus i kalevelevan, tjevutanga a vitjuqan.
English: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

Amis: tjaumeljai a qudjalj, cemdas anga a qadaw, minqut anga a quljivangeraw.
English: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

Amis: namakuda a kalevelevan izua i tjanusun?
English: What's the weather like where you are?

Amis: mezangal aravac a vali imaza i tjanuamen.
English: We're going to have a big storm here.

Amis: namakuda a i tjanumun a kalevelevan?

English: Very well, out of the big sun.

Amis: uri vaik anga ken a sema gakku.
English: I have to go to school.

Amis: vucelelj a kalevalevan, kavau a pakaliyaw.
English: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

Amis: uri vaik anga ken a casaw.
uri qemudjalj a paljeqaca nusauni, paqenetju anga kemacu tua kausua.
English: It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

Amis: napageleng anga tasauni, nusauni tjara qemudjalj.
English: There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

Amis: matu naqemudjalj anga, tjevetjeveng a kadjalanan.
English: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

Amis: naqemudjalj? a ku tjevetjeveng a su kinacavacavan?
English: Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

Amis: qemudjaqudjalj anga a i casaw, ini kaken a nakemacu tua kausua.
English: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

Amis: qacavali ravac a vali, vecengel a ku qulu ta ku kinivalian.
English: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

Amis: mezangal a qadaw, malingac aken ta ku kinipaqadavan.
English: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

Amis: namadraudrw aken a kemacu tua inpic.
English: I forgot to bring my pen.

Amis: namadraudraw aken a kemacu ta ku qecap.
English: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

Amis: inika ken a nakemacu uta, vaiki a veneli.
English: I don’t have one either, let’s go buy one.

Amis: bulai a vaik itjen a venli ta inpic?
English: Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?

Amis: bulai, uri venli aken uta ta siulaulau.
English: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

Amis: bulai a vaik itjen a venli ta tja kenamain?
English: Let’s go get breakfast, shall we?
No, I’ve already eaten at home.

Amis: namadraudraw aken a semljec tua ku bintu.
English: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

Amis: namadraudraw ken a kemacu tua ku bintu.
English: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

Amis: pai numayan tjakanau anga ku bintu!
English: Then let’s eat my lunch box together!
What do you want to eat for lunch?

Amis: uri keman aken ta cenglej nagakku.
English: I want a nutritious school lunch.
What do you want to eat for lunch?

Amis: nakemacu aken tucu a qadaw ta bintu, tjakanau anga nu sikecengcengelj!
English: I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!

Amis: bulai a vaik itjen a benulu ta lanciu?
English: Let’s go play basketball, shall we?

Amis: bulai a vaik itjen a benulu ta pangeciu?

English: Please help me with the broom.

Amis: uii, kusipavayan aicu a suapan tjanusun.
English: Okay, here’s a broomstick for you.
Can you help me with the cloth?

Amis: semuasuap aken, alapan aken ayau ti Kapi.
English: I’m sweeping the floor and you asked Kapi to carry it for you.

Amis: kungakungai aravac a kasintan, sau zukingu anan.
English: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

Amis: uii, vaik aken a malap ta zuking.
English: Okay, I’ll go get the cloth.

Amis: kungakungai aravac azua qezung, sau djuasi anan.
English: That window is very dirty, go clean it.

Amis: mayanan, inianan a ku pakasuap taimaza.
English: Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.

Amis: uri vaik aken a kemin ta sinsi.
English: I’m going to see my teacher.

Amis: uri kemuda anga sun nuvaik anga sun i gakku?
English: What do you do after school?

Amis: uri vaik aken a semnai katua ku qali.
English: I’m going to sing with my friends.

Amis: uri kemuda anga timadju nuvaik i gakku?

English: May I ask if Kivi is home?
She’s at home, please come in.

Amis: neka timadju, anema nu sikim tjaimadju?
English: She’s not here, what can I do for you?
Grandpa, I’m Vais, please open the door.

Amis: ti Api aken, kemim aken tjanusun a kivangavang.
English: Kacaw, I’m Api, I’ve come to play with you.

Amis: cuaicuai anga itjen a inika mecevung.
ui lja! nasingelit aken tjanusun. idu ka sudjusudjui lja!
English: Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!
Please sit down and have some tea.

Amis: uii, sa sanguaq aravac nutja pacunan aicu a kudamunu.
makesa anga sinan kaiven ni kina, idu kani anga!
English: Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

Amis: suliyavu a kemen, nuka sun a qaliqali.
English: Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

Amis: liyaw anga ravac aku kinan, mavedu aken aravac.
English: I ate a lot, I’m full.

Amis: su liyavu a keman, maya masiyaq.
uri vaik anga ken, ku kivalau anga nutjaivililj.
English: I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

Amis: salilim anga, uri vaik anga ken a tjumaq.
uii, nuizua su zikang kivalau anga a sema tjanuamen.
English: Okay, come to my house sometime.

Amis: bulabulay mun, tucu a qadaw uri kacuin mun nua sinsin a sema qinaljan a kivala tua ramaljemaljeng.
English: Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

Amis: bulay yu! uri qivu amen tua kai a pinayuanan kata ramaljemaljeng.
English: Okay! We have to speak Paiwanese to the seniors.

Amis: vuvu, mangetjengetjez amen a pacun tjanusun.
English: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

Amis: saigu mun a qivu ta pinayuanan a kai! aku kinananguaq!
bulabulay mun, tucu a qadaw uri kacuin mun nua sinsi a semapuvaquan a karakuda.
English: Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

Amis: idu a mapuljat kasarisaringu, paqenetju a nunanemanemanga.
English: Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

Amis: uii, sinsi, nia inalap anga a penuljat a nia nemanema.
English: Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.
You go get the bird catcher.

Amis: uii, tiaken a vaik a venilad taqayaqayam.
English: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

Amis: bulabulai mun a mapuljat, tucu a qadaw uri vaik itjen a sema puqemuzimuzipan.
English: Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

Amis: kakubulai aravc! uri kemuda itjen a semazua?
English: Awesome! How are we going to get there?

Amis: kasarisaringu a mapuljat, uri venli itjen tua kipu.
English: Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

Amis: a i tjaiqayaw pu qaqayaman, a i tjailikuz pu qatjuvian, pacunu a kisumadju.
English: There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

Amis: iniamakuda, sau pacunu numaya ta qayaqayam.
English: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

Amis: ucevucevungi anga imaza nu itanga tukian/milingan.
English: We’ll be back in an hour.

Amis: anema su pinacunan tucu a qadaw?
napacu aken ta liyaw aravc a qatjuvi kata liyaw aravac a qaqayam.
English: I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

Amis: kaljavaw aken a palamu, mazeli anga ku kula.
English: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

Amis: bulay a vaik itjen a ljemangui?
tjuruvu aravac a caucau a ljemanguljanguy imaza.
English: There are a lot of people swimming here.

Amis: vacan azua izua, bulai a tjaljumaza itjen a ljemangui.
English: The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?

Amis: natjevavaw aken ta basu a mangetjez.
uri kemuda su a vaik a sema kiukai?
English: How do you go to church?

Amis: maka MRT timadju a sema gakku.
English: He took the subway to school.

Amis: anema pinakavavavan nua su vuvu a vaik a venli ta ljaceng?
English: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

Amis: maka utubaiy timadju a vaik a venli ta ljaceng.
English: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

Amis: kamuda sun a vaik a sema Lan-Yu?
English: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

Amis: uri maka varukur aken a sema Lan-Yu.
English: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

Amis: uri kemuda timadju a vaik a sema Lan-Yu.
English: How did he get to Orchid Island?

Amis: uri maka hikuki timadju a sema Lan-Yu.
English: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

Amis: anema tjinvavavan nimadju a sema Takau?
English: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

Amis: namaka Kau-Tii/ HSR timadju a sema Takau.
English: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

Amis: nama ka kisia timadju a sema Taitung?
English: Did he take a train to Taitung?

Amis: uii, namaka kisia timadju a sema Taitung.
English: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

Amis: namaka kisia timadju a sema Taitung?
English: Did he take a train to Taitung?

Amis: ini, namaka hikuki timadju a sema Taitung.
English: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

Amis: izua ljaljevavavan tua basu imaza i dudut?

Amis: ita tukian ki djemaljun i Tai-Ciu.

English: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

Amis: nu nakecengelj anga izua su zikang? saljinga ken tu vaik a kivala tjanusun a ki maqati?
English: Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?
Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

Amis: izua su zikang nutiyaw? sakivadaq aken tjanusun ta patjara tjaucikel nua se Payuan.
English: Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of the Paiwan tribe.

Amis: uri vaik aken a sema vavua nu tiyaw, neka ken itjumaq.
English: I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

Amis: kemljang sun aravac tua kakudanan nua se Payuan, sa kitulu aken tjanusun.
English: I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Paiwan, so I would like to ask you a few questions.

Amis: ini a liyaw aravac aku kinljang, ljakua maqati aken a kipapuljat a temvela.
English: I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

Amis: maqati aken a pasasing? sikananguaqan a paqenetj aken nu vencik anga ken.
English: Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

Amis: aki pida anga a su cavilj?
a su valjaw se Payuan uta?
ini, se Piniyumayan a caucau timadju.
anemanema nu kaiyan a su kinasaigu a qivu?
saigu aken a qivu tua kai a nase Payuan kata kai nua se Piniyumayan.
English: I can speak Paiwan and Puyuma.

Amis: maleva aken a kivadaq tjanusun, pasemalavi amen, tua patjara sinanpalisi itua qemaljup?

Amis: uii, ruqaljup aken kamaqacuvucuvung anan aken.
English: Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

Amis: masalu, bulai aravac a su tulu tucu a qadaw.

Amis: paquliqulid angata a ku sinipasemalaw, tjaucikel a kemasisicuayan nua tja sevalitan.
English: All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

Amis: patjemaza a ku kivadaq. masalu aravac tua su pasemalaw.

Amis: ku vaikai anga, saljinga ken a lemangeda tua tjaliyaw a milimilingan nutjaivililj.
English: I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

Amis: uii lja, galju anga i djalan.
bilabulai sun, anema a uri su velin?

Amis: uri venli aken tu ita a kuppu.
English: I want to buy a cup.

Amis: bulabulai sun, anema a uri su velin?

Amis: uri venli aken tu ita a tjalupung.
English: I want to buy a hat.

Amis: neka, ini amen a paveliveli ta saviki.

Amis: pavai aken tu tjelu a cavuan.

Amis: uri venli aken tu tjanudrusa a abula.
English: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

Amis: pida tjingtjing a uri su velin?

English: There are three left, all for you!

Amis: pazangal anga aravc aicu, maqati a madjuluin a pagalju?
English: It’s too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

English: No, this is already very cheap.

Amis: uri ku alapen aicu a tacavu a alju.

English: Can I borrow money from you?
Yes! How much do you need?

Amis: namadraudraw aken a masi ginpiya, maqadi aken a kisedjam tjanusun?
English: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

Amis: inika ken a nakemacu tua ginpiya uta!
English: I don’t have any money either!

Amis: namadraudraw aken a kemacu tua ginpiya, maqadi aken a kisedjam tjanusun?
English: I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

Amis: ini, katjaisangas a su kinisedjam tjanuaken a ginpiya inianan ka su pacikeli.
English: No, you haven’t paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

Amis: maqati aken a kisedjam tua su kava?
maqadi aken a kisedjam tua su sapitj?
pasedjaman tjanuaken a su zidinsia uii?
English: Can I borrow your bicycle, please?
Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

Amis: qemudjalj anga, inika ken a nakemacu tua kausua, maqati aken a su pasedjaman?
English: It’s raining, I don’t have an umbrella, can you lend me one?

Amis: ita a ku kausua, pai kadjadjalain a kiljaung!
English: I only have an umbrella, let’s stick together!

Amis: aicu a ku kinisedjam tjanusun ka tjaisangas a sapitj, ku pacikelaw tjanusun.
English: This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

Amis: nu sapacun anan sun ta anema a sapitj pasemalavi anga ken.
English: You can tell me what else you want to read.

Amis: numakudakuda a uri ku sipacikelan ta kinpiya tjanusun?
English: When do I have to pay you back?
It doesn’t matter, you can talk about it when you have money.
When are you going to pay me back?

Amis: ku su kiamai anga sun nutiyaw.
English: I will return it to you tomorrow.

Amis: nungida anga uri su pacikelen aku sapitj?
English: When are you going to return my book?

Amis: matu ku pinacikel anga ka tiyaw?
English: Didn’t I return it to you yesterday?

Amis: aicu a kinpic sinipasedjam ni Kuliw tjanusun?
English: Did Kuliw lend you this pen?

Amis: uii, ku kinisedjam tjaimadju tucu a qadaw.
English: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

Amis: aicu a inpic su kinisedjam tjai Kuliw?
English: Did you borrow this pen from Kuliw?
No, this is what mom bought.

Amis: neka anga nu qatiya, sau kisedjamu tjai Umi.
English: We’re out of salt, let’s go borrow some from Umi.

Amis: sau qaqivu ti Umi tu pacikel ta kinisedjam a kinpiya tjanuaken.
English: Go tell Umi to give me back my money.
How much does she owe you?

Amis: uri vaik aken a sema puljacengan a temalem ta ljaceng.
English: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

Amis: pucemel anga ravac, semucemecemel aken, uri puzaljum anan nusauni.
English: There’s too much grass, I’m cutting it, I’ll have to water it later.

Amis: maqati sun a pusaladj tjanuaken a malap ta tjakit kata capelai?
English: Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.

Amis: ku vinliqad anga qipu tasauni, uri tja tjugutan nusauni.
English: I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

Amis: maqati anga a tjakiljaceng a su talem a ljaceng?
English: Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

Amis: maqati anga kiljacengen a kanran, azua ljaqacai inianan kamaqati a kiljacengen.
English: The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

Amis: waw! liyaw aravac a su kinivurasi.
English: Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

Amis: maqati a su pusaladjan aken a pasa kubaw?
English: Will you help me with the barn?

Amis: puaraarai amen tu djemameq ta ciqaw.
English: We’re releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

Amis: liyaw angaravac a ciqaw i purur.
English: The fish basket has been full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?

Amis: avan a vuluq a ku sivuluq taciqaw.
English: I shoot fish with a spear.

Amis: saigu sun a penanaq a qemaljup?
English: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

Amis: tjaliyaw a pudringai aken a qemaljup, nuremaketjan uta izua nu masi kuang masi vatu aken.
English: I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.
This is the road the boar took.

Amis: aicu djukap nua vavui, pai aicu avan a djaladjalan nua vavui.
English: These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

Amis: ari kadjaljavi a vaik a pacun tua tja dringai, matu nadjemameq anga tua sacemel.
English: Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

Amis: matu semqusequ anga a vatu, ari vaiki a kirimu.
English: The dog seems to have smelled it. Let’s follow them.

Amis: aicu qezetj cu a pudringai, sidjamdjameq tua kulavaw.
English: This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.
What is that thing you put there?

Amis: seluc tua kula azua dringai, avan a nia sidjamedjameq tua takec.
English: It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

Amis: maleva itjen tapagaugaw nua naqemati, liayaw a tja djinameq a sacemel tucu a qadaw.
English: Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

Amis: uii lja! tjakacuaw a semaqinaljan satja kaqepuqepuan!
English: Yeah! Let’s take it back to the tribe and share it!

Amis: tucu a qadaw uri temulu a ken tjanu itjen tu anemaya ikai a sepaiwan ta qemuziquzip.
English: I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Paiwan language today.

Amis: tucu a qadaw uri temulu a ken tjanuitjen tu anemaya ikai a sepaiwan ta kudamunu.
English: I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Paiwan language today.

Amis: ini, ni aljuy cu a itung.
sinsi, neka nakemacu a ken ta sapitj.
English: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

Amis: meseljangu a pacun katua su ljaqedi a salasaladj.
English: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

Amis: ku si pasedjaman tja nu sun a ku siquliqulip.
English: I will lend you my eraser.

Amis: uri patjezua nga men ta kitulu, kipapaulingavu anga ta djalan nu sematjumaq.
English: It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

Amis: uri patjezua anga tjen ta kitulu aiyanga mapuljat.
English: The class is over, goodbye everyone.

Amis: nanguanguaq mun a mapuljat, ti piya a ku ngadan.
English: Hello everyone, my name is piya.

Amis: djavadgavay a mapuljat, ti lulji a ku ngadan.
English: Hello everyone, my name is lulji.

Amis: nanguanguaq sun piya, ti kapi a ken.
nanguanguaq sun, ti lulji a ken.
nanguanguaq sun lulji, ti kapi a ken.
tiaken kina ni kuliw ti tjuku a ken.
tiaken kaka a tjaljaljak a vavayan, ni kuliw ti aljui a ku ngadan.
English: I am kuliw’s sister. My name is aljui.

Amis: ku sinsi timadju, ti sakinu timadju.
ku kaka tjavulung a uqaljay timadju timadju ti camak.
tima ngadan na su kaka tjavulung a vavayan?
English: What is your elder sister’s name?

Amis: ti muni a ngadan na ku kaka tjavulung a vavayan.
English: My elder sister’s name is muni.

Amis: tima ngadan na su kaka tjaljaljak a vavayan?
English: What is your younger sister’s name?

Amis: ti vais a ngadan na ku kaka tjaljaljak a vavayan.
English: My younger sister’s name is vais.

Amis: pida nga cavilj na su kaka tjavulung a uqaljay tucu?
English: How old is your elder brother?

Amis: tapuluq sa lima anga cavilj nimadju tucu.
pida nga cavilj na su kaka tjaljaljak a uqaljay tucu?
English: How old is your younger brother?
Do you have schools in your community?

Amis: kitulutulu sun itua nu qinaljan a gakku?
English: Do you study in your tribe’s school?

Amis: ui, nu i gakku amen a kitulutulu namaya men ta tacemekeljan.
English: Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

Amis: ku kaka tjavulung a vavayan timadju.

Amis: bulai kaciyuri anga nu tjaivililj a panadip ta ciqaw.
English: Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

Amis: numaya nu tjaivililj ku tuluai anga sun tu kemuda semanaya ta surunung.
English: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

Amis: garavagavagav anga su panadip manu izua nga ciqaw a na mapanadip rakacu a kirimu.
English: Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

Amis: mayanan mariqeriq aravac a varukur tjemaza ken a remakac ta panadip sazuau pusaladji aken a malap ta arai.
English: Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

Amis: rakacu a pasamaza i tja nu a ken ku pusaladja sun a remakac.
English: Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

Amis: bulai angata tucu na mapeljuq anga ciqaw i ta surungung.
English: Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

Amis: vaiki a kirimu a semiljeva ta tja salasaladj.
English: Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

Amis: mayanga kivangavang, qiladju a kirimu tua sangel.
English: Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

Amis: sikalima qadaw tua singci tasauni, uri semekez nutiyaw, ari a kivangavang!
English: It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

Amis: nanguaq lja! ari a sema pana.
English: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

Amis: sikatjelulj a qadaw nutiyaw, ari vaiki anga nu pasuvililj tua cengelj a benuru!
English: Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

Amis: uri anema su kudain nu tiyaw a kadjaman?
English: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

Amis: niciyubi nutiyaw, uri sema kiukay amen kati kina.
English: Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

Amis: sa mutjaq aen, uri sema kaya en.
English: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

Amis: sinsi, saqetju a u tjiyalj, uri sema kaya en.
English: Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?

Amis: palamu kisemekaz anga kitulu, vaiku anga nusauni.
English: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

Amis: sinsi, marusaqetju a u qulu, uri cingciya sa sekez nu pasuvililj tua cengalj.
English: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

Amis: uri cingciyaen nu tjavililj a singci i, sa vaik aen a kipucemel.
English: Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

Amis: saqetju a tjiyalj nimadju, i kaya timadju.
English: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

Amis: sinsi, saqetju a liqu ni Kuliu, na cingciya tucu a qadaw.
English: Teacher, Kuliu has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

Amis: akumaya inikana mangtjez ti Tjuku kasauni?
ti Sakinu aen a Tjuridri, tapuluq anga u cavilj tucu.
English: My name is Tjuridri, and I’m 10 years old.

Amis: anema nu zukuan sun a kakedriyan?
English: What ethnic group are you from?
Are all your family members indigenous?
Yes, my whole family is Paiwan.
Are all your family members indigenous?

Amis: ini, sePaiwana u kama, pairang a u kina.
English: No, my father is Paiwan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

Amis: ni Sakinu a Tjuridri aen a aljak.
English: I am Sakinu a Tjuridri’s child.

Amis: su kama zua caucau? pidanga cvavilj nimadju?
English: Is that your father? How old is he?

Amis: unem anga puluq a cavilj nimadju.
su kama zua caucau? pidanga cavilj nimadju?
English: Is that your father? How old is he?

Amis: malji, nia ramaljeng i qinaljan timadju, alu anga puluq a cavilj nimadju.
English: No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

Amis: pida nga cavilj na su kaka tjavulung a uqaljay?
tapuluq saka alu anga cavili nimadju.
tjavulung tjanusun tu liyaw a cavilj na su kaka tjavulung a uqaljay?
English: Is your brother much older than you?

Amis: lima cavilj a sikatjavulung tjanuaen nimadju.
sicuayan anga u ljinengljengan tjanusun, qadjawsun a na meqaca nga?
English: I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

Amis: uy lja, izua nga 130kunghun a u kinaqaca.
neka ei, na pasaliu sun a pacun.
uy lja, izua 30 kungcin a u kinasdjelung tucu.
uri karim aen tjaysinsi a ma pankungse.
English: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

Amis: uri vak a venric tua cemel timadju.
English: He’s going to throw away the trash.

Amis: i ljaljanguyan timadju, uri kiseljavak tua malalumalj a ljemanguy timadju nu sauni.
English: He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

Amis: inu ti Tjuku? uri kiseljavak tua malalumalj a mintuluq timadju nu sauni.
English: Where is Tjuku? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

Amis: izua i litang timadju, u vikau a qemaqivu.
English: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

Amis: ari vaiki a sema caucang dri!
English: Let’s go to the playground together.

Amis: vaik anan aen a venli tua cengelj, u su karimau anga nu sauni.
English: I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

Amis: ari vaiki a qemalu tua piyentang dri!
English: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

Amis: karimu tua zuma caucau, uri karim aen tua sinsi.
English: You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

Amis: Kuliu uri malalumalj tua cemugecug tua buru nusauni?
English: Is Kuliu competing in croquet today?

Amis: neka ei, uri kiseljavak timadju tua malalulamalj a mintjuljuk.
English: No, he’s competing in high jump.

Amis: nu ita undukay a qadaw uri kiseljavak sun tua malalumalj?
English: Will you compete in the sports day?

Amis: uy ei, uri kiseljavak aen tua malalumalj a mintuluq.
nu ita undukay a qadaw uri kiseljavak sun tua malalumalj?
English: Will you compete in the sports day?

Amis: uri kiseljavak aen a cemugecug tua buru.
anema uri tjakudain ita malalumalj tua undu a qadaw?
English: What will we do in the sports day?

Amis: uri malalumalj amen a mavaviljvilj tua calis .
English: We will compete in tug of war.

Amis: uri pavelitjen tua kakanen nu malalumalj a qadaw?
English: Will we sell food at the sports day?

Amis: na malap sun tua sangasangasan a nadan ei, maru qizing sun lja!
English: Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

Amis: i tjumaq ti vuvu a vavayan?

English: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

Amis: i tjumaq ti vuvu a vavayan?
neka i tjumq, tjauvaik a sasaw nu qzemetj ki tjumaq.
English: No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

Amis: i tjumaq ti vuvu a uqaljay?
ita tjayvavau a kinayzuan, savavavu a karim timdju.
English: He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

Amis: a, ti Kuliu lja, sicuyan anga ljinengeljengan tjanusun, nanguanguaq sun?
English: It’s Kuliu. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

Amis: nanguanguaq aen lja! mangtjez aen tu makakay tjanusun.
English: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

Amis: cemalcala tua djamay i kakesan timadju, u vaikau a qemaqivu.
English: He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

Amis: na vaik a sema pudjurikukuan a djemameq tua djurikuku.
English: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

Amis: neka i tjumaq a nu vuvu a uqaljay, i kavuavuan timadju, kaljavau i tjumaq timdju dri!
English: Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

Amis: mangtjez anga sun ama i Kuliu dri!
cuacuay anga ljinengeljengan tjanusun, na meqaca nga sun.
English: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

Amis: pacunan sun a mangtjez, maru maleva en. 。
English: It’s so good to see you.

Amis: u sinipavay cu a pangudralj tjanumun, pasa pinsiang ngu!
English: Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

Amis: sicuayan anga su pinangtjezan, u qaivuau a mapuljat tu mangtjez a keman.
English: It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

Amis: saldji tu pukakudan, temkel aen tua uciya, ari a matua papasedjaluan a makakay.
English: No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

Amis: masalu tua su pinasedjaluan, uri tjumaq anga en.
English: Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

Amis: tjauculjuin cu a djurikuku, kacu a tjumaq sa galjuyanga keman.
English: This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

Amis: maqati tu mecevung itjen ita pasuvililj tua cengelj nutiyaw?
English: Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

Amis: maqati, kaljavari tu maccevung itjen inuan?
maqati tu tjigaku iten? uri tja sansasingen.
English: How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

Amis: nanguaq a sema kakaqepuan, uri kemava en tua kinacalisiyan a itung.
English: Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

Amis: bulay aravac nu pautez a temelak a vuciyar nua sakura itua niya qinqljan. nu venutilak anga vuciyar idu anga karim tjanuaen.
English: The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

Amis: uri kemaljava itjen a patje kaljavevuan, pasu gemalju anga ravac!
English: That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

Amis: sa pangtjezu anga ita palisiyan nua masalut a qadaw!
English: Then come during our Harvest Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

Amis: u su kivadaqay tu’ “akumaya sa cemikel sun a sema qinaljan a kemayzua?’’
English: May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

Amis: akumaya ikasun a temulu i lizuk?
English: Why not teach in the city?

Amis: ayatua veleqed en tua u qinaljan, na saljinga en uta tu pasucikel a qemeljing ta i qinaljan uta.
English: Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

Amis: saigu sun aravac a tjemenun, tima na temulu tjanusun?
English: You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

Amis: avan a u vuvu a vavayan. tjaljasaiguan a tjemenun i qinaljan timadju.
English: It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

Amis: nakemuda sa venerung sun a kicaquan ta tjemenun?
English: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

Amis: nia kakudan a tjemenun, na sa patudur aen tua nia kakudan.
English: Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

Amis: sanguaq ngata tja tekelen aicu a vinava vaqu.
maru saigu sun angata, cuacuay itjen a venava?
English: You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

Amis: ikacuacuay, tjara izua pitju a qadaw mavava nga. tja pakakesain anan a pita lalidringan avaqu, sa pizuay tua djulis a kemadikat, maqati anga djilungen.
English: No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

Amis: izua kamangulj katua ljaugiyu, tiyaen a na temalem a macidilj lja!
English: I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

Amis: pida valjitjuq nu velin a ljemedrusa?
drusaiday sa limapuluq a valjitjuq a penuljat.
tjenglay aen tucu a itung, pidapaisuan a veli?
English: I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

Amis: limaiday a valjitjuq a veli nucu a itung.
pazangal aravac, maqati tu tjamadjulu a pagalju?
English: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

Amis: inikamaqati, nu pitjamadjulu uri masipun aen.
English: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

Amis: uynumaya! numaya venli aen tu taitungan tua qecengecengel a itung.
English: Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

Amis: na saljinga en taicu a tjakit katua pariyuk.
English: I want this knife and this pot.

Amis: drusa kuzuljan a valjituq a veli a penuljat. u sinaliman a malang, tjaramaqati a siseljudj a cuacuay.
English: It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

Amis: u tjumaljay a u qaliyaliyan tu veneli, maqti tu tjamadjulu anan?
English: I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

Amis: nanguaq lja! u supuaw tu 8ce anga.
English: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

Amis: pangtezu a pacun lja! izua itung katua tjalupung a sipaveliveli.
English: Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

Amis: nu ita itung tjelu a iday sa limapuluq a valjitjuq, nu tjelu a itung kuzulj a valjitjuq a veli.
English: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

Amis: veneli aen tu ita sakamaya, pavay aen tua vaquan.
English: I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

Amis: nanguanguaq sun, na saveneli aen tua djuadjuay a tjinaljak katua ljinivanger a qalum.
English: Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

Amis: sepaveli anga penuljat a tjinaljek, izuanan a u tjinanaq a yuping, veneli sun?
English: The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

Amis: nanguaq dri! pavay aen tu masanita, veneli anga en nu tjayvililj tua tjinaljek.
English: Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

Amis: nanguaq, u ravavaw tua lubulubuk, nu maytazua limapuluq a valjitjuq.
English: Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.

Amis: djavadjavai a masantalj.uri temulu a ken a nu sinsi tua patjara kakanen, sa anemaya a penayuanan?
English: Hello everyone. Today I am going to teach you how to say Paiwanese for food.
Do you understand what the teacher says?

Amis: kemeljang sun tua anemayamaya ken a su sinsi?
English: Do you understand what the teacher says?

Amis: sinsi, ini aken a pulingalingaw. pai qaqivuanan a puita.
English: I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

Amis: ini a ken a lemadenga, pai tja pasiqacauana?
English: I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

Amis: pacunu a pasamaza! kicuali a ken a semupu a puita.
English: Look here, please! Repeat after me.

Amis: pai kituluanan a puitanga. tja pasiqacau ananri.
English: Read it again. Please speak louder.

Amis: sinsi, madraudrav a ken a kemacu tua ku inepic.
English: I forgot to bring my pen.

Amis: sinsi, ini a ken a paqenetj a kemacu tua ku inepic.
English: I forgot to bring my pen.

Amis: sinsi, madraudrav a ken a kemacu tua ku siquliqulip.
English: I forgot to bring my eraser.

Amis: sinsi, ini a ken a paqenetj a kemacu tua ku siquliqulip.
English: I forgot to bring my eraser.

Amis: pai kisedjamu tua su sapitjan tua siquliqulip.
English: Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

Amis: pasedjami a ken tua su siquliqulip ui?
semu-a anga men tua nia kitulu.
djalju mazai tua tja kitulu, cevucevungi anga nu tjaivililj tua pulavai.
English: Class dismissed, see you next week.

Amis: aljak a ken ni Sedjam, ti Qipu a ken.
English: I am Sedjam's son and my name is Qipu.

Amis: vencik a ken ni sinsi i Puljaljuyan, ti Qipu a ken.
English: I am a student of Puljaljuyan and my name is Qipu.

Amis: a ngadan ni kama pinaka ti Sedjam.
u kaka a uqaljai a tjavulung tjanuaken timadju, ti Bua timadju.
English: He's my brother, his name is Bua.

Amis: ini, a ngadan nimadju ti Apang.
ti Aljui timadju. ku kina ti kinai Aljui timadju.
ku drava timadju, ti Ipi a ngadan nimadju.
English: She's a friend of mine, her name is Ipi.

Amis: tapuluq saka drusa a cavilj nimadju tucu.
pidanga a cavilj ni tjama tucu?
limapluq anga a cavilj na ku kama tucu.

English: How many brothers and sisters do you have?
How many brothers and sisters do you have?

Amis: izua madrusa a tjavulung tja nu aken a ku kaka a uqaljai katua vavayan, sa macidilj a tjaljaljak tja nu aken ku kaka a vavayan.
English: I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

Amis: izua a su kaka a tjavulung tjanusun a uqaljai?
neka nu ku kaka a tjavulung tjanuaen a uqaljai.

English: How many people are in your family?

Amis: izua men a ma sepatj a tacemekeljan.
English: There are four of us in our family.

Amis: i tulutulu a ken i Taihuku.
ku kama timadju a siruvetjek ni kama.
anema a kipusengesengesenganan ni tjama a siruvetjek ni tjaina?
English: What does your uncle do for a living?

Amis: ku kaka a vavayan a tjavulung tjanuaken timadju.
izua sengesengan ni su kaka a vavayan?
English: Does your sister have a job?

Amis: ui, ljakua se Bunun zuku timadju.

English: Yes, we are all very tall.

Amis: ma gakkuku anga su kaka a vavayan a tjaljaljak tjanusun?
English: Does your sister go to school?

Amis: saiqu a penaiyuana a su kaka a tjaljaljak tjanusun?
English: Do your siblings speak the language?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.
How many brothers and sisters do you have?

Amis: izua ma tjelu a ku siruvetjek.
English: I have three brothers and sisters.

Amis: na matevelj a su kama katua su kina tua umaq?
English: Do you live with your parents?

Amis: ui, namatevelj a ku kama atua ku kina.
English: Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

Amis: na kiatevelj sun tua su vuvu a uqaljai katua vavayan?
English: Do you live with your grandparents?

Amis: ini, ini a ken a nakitatevelj tjayamadju.
English: No, I didn’t live with them.

Amis: na kitatevelj a ken tjai kama, tjai kina, ktua ku kaka a tjavulung tjanuaken a uqaljai.
English: I live with my father, mother and brother.
When are you going back to the tribe?

Amis: nu kaljapulavayan tua zulezulan maumaq aken sakamaya.
English: I will go back in the summer.
The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?

Amis: ljamaljeqel aravac, sa itungu a pakaliyaw.
English: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

Amis: inika ljaljeqeleqel inika zemulezulezul, sarenguaq a racac.
English: It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

Amis: neka nu qerepus, mapacucun anga a vitjuqan.
English: There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

Amis: namakuda a kinaqadavan nua i casaw?
tjaumeljai, maqadaw anga, sa tjevuta anga a quljivangaraw.
English: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

Amis: tjau maka qudjalj, sa maqadaw anga, sa puquljivangaraw anga.
English: The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
What's the weather like where you are?
We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.

Amis: uri vaik anga ken a kitulu.
English: I have to go to school.

Amis: ljemaljeqel aravac, sa itungu a pakaliyaw.
English: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

Amis: ki qemudjalj a paljaqaca nu sauni, paqenetju a masi ljaung.
English: It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

Amis: cemlalalalaq anga, ki qemudjalj nu sauni.
English: There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

Amis: na qemudjalj ta sauni, sa meljai anga tucu.
English: It just rained, and now it's stopped.

Amis: matu na qemudjalj anga, tjevetjeveng a djalan.
English: It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

Amis: na qemudjalj? Aqu sun a tjevetjeveng a penulingelingetj?
English: Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

Amis: qemudjaqudjalj a i casaw, ini aken a namasi ljaung.
English: It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

Amis: paljaqaca aravac sa vali, lemutud a ku qulu tua ku kinipavalian.
English: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

Amis: maqadaw aravac, vucengel a ku qulu tua ku kinipaqadavan.
English: The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

Amis: dremaudraw anga ken a kemacu tua inepic.
English: I forgot to bring my pen.

Amis: dremaudraw anga ken a kemacu tua qecap.
English: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

Amis: malim anga ken a kemacu tua qecap.
English: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

Amis: ini aken uta a nakemacu, ari veli-i.
English: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.
Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

Amis: vaiki a veneli tua inepic ui?
English: Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

Amis: nanguaq, sa uri veneli anan aken tua siquliqulip.
English: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

Amis: ui, sa uri veneli aken uta tua siquliqulip.
English: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

Amis: ari veli-i tua tja kenamain ui?
English: Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

Amis: tjuari, na kenama anga ken i tjumaq.
English: No, I've already eaten at home.

Amis: dremaudraw anga ken a semeljec tua bintu.
English: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

Amis: malim anga ken a semeljec tua bintu.
English: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

Amis: dremaudraw anga ken a kemacu tua bintu.
English: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

Amis: malim anga ken a kemacuc tua bintu.
English: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

Amis: pai tja kanaw a ku bintu numaya.
English: Then let's eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?
What are you having for lunch?

Amis: uri keman aken tua sinancengelj nua gakku.
English: I want a nutritious school lunch.
What are you having for lunch?

Amis: uri keman su tua nema tua cengelj?
English: What are you having for lunch?

Amis: nakemasi cenglj a ken tua bintu tucu, pai kaljingulji a kincengelj!
English: I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!

Amis: vaiki a menali tua lanciyu ui?
English: Let's go play basketball, shall we?

Amis: vaiki a menalji tua pangciyu ui?
ini, inika ken a vaik, uri kitulu aken.

English: Please help me with the broom.

Amis: ui, ku sivayan cu a suapan tjanusun.
English: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

Amis: pai alapan aken tua zuking ui?

Amis: ui, ku kaka a tjavulung a uqaljay timadju.
a se paiwan zuku timadju uta?
ljemaljeqel a pagalju a kinaqadavan, temekel itjen tua linalja.
English: It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

Amis: paruzemulezul tucu a kinaqadavan, semuqaca itjen a temekel tua zaljum.
English: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

Amis: mezangal aravac a qadav, paqenetju a iljaljaung.
English: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.
There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

Amis: neka nu qadav nutiav, uri nakemelebav, mezangal a vali.
English: It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

Amis: uri naljemaljaqel, emuba itjen a casav.
English: It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.
How’s the weather on the weekend?

Amis: uri namaljenguaq a qadav nu pulavalavay.
English: It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

Amis: ui, uri maljenguaq a qadav tuazua, inika uri qemudjalj.
English: It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.
The rain stops and the sun comes out.

Amis: qemudjaqudjalj anga, inika ken a nakemacu ta kausua.
English: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

Amis: neka nu qudjalj tucu, nu masukincengelj kiqemudjalj, kemacu itjen sakamaya tua kausua.
English: It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

Amis: nu icavilj a kaljaljeqelan atu’i uri ljemaljeqel kemuda?
English: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

Amis: ui, uri ljemaljeqel aravac nu icavilj, emitung itjen a pakaliav.
English: Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

Amis: tucu a cavilj a kaljazulzulan ’atui uri zemulezul?
English: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

Amis: ui, uri zumelezul aravac, semuqaca itjen a temekel tua zaljum.
English: Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

Amis: tjengelay aken tua kaljavevean, sarenguaq a vali.
English: I like spring because the weather is warm.

Amis: inika ken a tjengelay tua kaljauraman, ru vali a kaljauraman pai.
English: I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

Amis: inika ken a paqenetj anga kemacu tua laqulj.
English: I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.

Amis: inika ken a paqenetj anga a kemacu tua siquliqulip.
English: I forgot to bring the eraser.

Amis: inika sun a paqenetj anga kemacu tua inpic?
English: Do you forget to bring your pen?

Amis: ui, pasedjami aken tua inpic ui?
English: Yes, can you lend me a pen?
What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?

Amis: anema su kinan ta su cengelj?
English: What did you have for lunch?

Amis: nakeman anga ken ta vutjulj na kuka.

English: You go first and I will catch up later.

Amis: sikuda, vaiki anan a semakuc tua laqulj.
English: No, we have to carry books first.
Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.
Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.

Amis: uri kemuda sun nu qemacuvung itjen tua tja kitulu i gakku?
English: What are you going to do after school?

Amis: uri kemuda timadju nu qemacuvung tua tja kitulu i gakku?
English: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

Amis: ui i tjumaq aken, saumaqanu a ’irimu.
neka ti Ljumeg i tjumaq! ti Vais aken, kemuda aya sun? ku qivuav anga ti Ljumeg nu mangtjez i tjumaq.
English: Ljumeg  is not at home. I am Vais. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

Amis: vuvu, ti Ljumeg kati Vais amen, pai suqeljevi a paljing!
English: Grandma, we are Ljumeg and Vais, please open the door for us.

Amis: ti Vais aken, kemikim aken tjai Kuljelje.
English: I am Vais, I am here for Kuljelje.

Amis: vuvu, mangtjez aken a kivala tjanusun.
English: Grandma, I am here to see you.

Amis: sicuayan anga su pinangtjezan, nasengelit anga ken tjanusun.
English: You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.
Vais, I am here to play with you.

Amis: saumaqanu a kirimu, cuayanga ken a kiljaljavaljava tjanusun.
English: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

Amis: avan cu a ku sinitalem a vurati, paqayamu a keman pai!
English: This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

Amis: avan cu a qaljemeqem a vurati.
English: The sweet potato is so sweet.

Amis: idu! paqayamu a keman tua ku sinitalem a kudamunu.
English: Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

Amis: qiladju! paqayamu a keman tuca ku sinitalem a puday!
English: Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

Amis: uwa! avancu a qaljemaqem a puday.
English: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

Amis: inika ken a maqati a keman tua tjianes, avan a pingku a keman aken.
English: I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

Amis: ui, tjengelay aken a keman tua piyapiya.
English: Sure, I like it very much.

Amis: ku sitjuljaan sun tua kudamunu tua su kanen.
English: Let me peel the fruit for you.

Amis: masalu, avancu a puqetim a kudamunu.
English: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

Amis: ku sialapan sun tua zaljum tua su tekelen.
English: I will bring you some water.

Amis: suliavu a keman, napakaliav aken a seman djamay.
English: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

Amis: suliavu a keman, liav anan a kinsa imaza.
English: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

Amis: saka inika ken na uri malumalj!
English: I’ll make myself at home then.

Amis: suliavu a keman, liav anan a imaza.
English: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

Amis: nasemuliav anga ken, inika ken a maqati anga patjaizua a keman.
English: I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

Amis: tucu a qadav uri kacuin mun ni sinsi a sema gade.
English: I will take you to the mountains today.

Amis: liav a cacalag i gade aya ti ’ina.
English: Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

Amis: tucu a qadav uri kacuin mum ni sinsi a sema vavua.
English: I will take you to the fields.

Amis: a vaik itjen a temuvulj ta qipu?
English: Are we going to loosen the soil?

Amis: uri sema inu itjen tucu a qadav?
uri kacuin itjen ni sinsi a sema pana.
English: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

Amis: uri sema inu itjen tucu a qadav?
uri kacuin itjen ni sinsi a sema gade.
English: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

Amis: a uri sema pana itjen tucu a qadav?
English: Are we going to the riverside today?

Amis: ini, uri kacuin itjen ni sinsi a sema gade.
English: No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

Amis: a uri vaik itjen a sema gade tucu a qadav?
English: Are we going to the mountains today?

Amis: ini, uri vaik itjen a sema vavua tucu a qadav.
English: No, we are going to the fields.

Amis: sinsi, anema uri tja pacunan i pana?
English: Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

Amis: sinsi, anema uri tja pacunan i gade?
English: Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

Amis: vaik itjen a pacun tua kadjiadji.
English: We are going to see butterflies.

Amis: uri kemuda itjen a sema vavua?
English: What are we going to do in the fields?

Amis: uri vaik itjen a pacun tua tja sinitalem a puday, kinemnem itjen tua sasiq, tjainan pai!
English: We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

Amis: sinsi, a vaik itjen a sema pana a emave’av/ljemanguy?

Amis: ini, uri vaik itjen a pacun tua quljicacenglav.
English: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

Amis: sinsi, a vaik itjen a sema vavua a temalen tua ljaceng?
English: Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

Amis: itjen a vaik a temuvulj ta qipu.
English: We are going to loosen the soil today.

Amis: tjaupacun aken tua qaqulidan a valjualjut a quljicacenglav.
English: Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

Amis: yi! wa! tjengelay aken aravac tua kadjiadji, bulay aravac.
English: Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

Amis: uzai a za minlayalayap a kadjiadji.

English: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

Amis: tjimazau a pacun, maya vaivaik a sema cadja yu!
English: Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

Amis: ui, inika men a uri vaik a ljiacadja.
English: Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

Amis: inika tjen a mekekelj, gemalju itjen a djemavac avan a se’ulilj sun.
English: Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.
I want to see them right away.

Amis: anema uri su pakazuanan a sema tapav?
English: How do you go to the block-house?

Amis: unting aken ta sidusiya a sema tapav.
anema uri pakazuanan a sema biyuing nimadju?
English: How does he go to the hospital?

Amis: anema uri su pakazuanan a sema bukutu?
English: How do you go to Penghu?

Amis: maka hikuki aken a sema bukutu. maka hikuki aken a sema bukutu.
English: I go to Penghu by plane.

Amis: anema uri su pakazuanan a sema bukutu?
English: How do you go to Penghu?

Amis: uri maka gungkang aken a sema bukutu.
English: I go to Penghu by boat.

uri maka kisiya ken a tjumaq.

English: Do you go to school by MRT?

Amis: ini, uri maka basu aken a sema gakku.

Amis: a namaka palidring sun a sema gakku?

Amis: a namaka kauti sun a sema Takav?

English: Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

Amis: namaka hikuki aken, tja djaljav a maka hikuku tua kisiya.

English: I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

Amis: a djemet a siyubai tua nu umaq?
English: Is the market close to your house?

Amis: inika djemet, maka utubatubai aken a sema siyubai.
English: No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.
